summary: This is an FBI News Briefing from July 22, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes sections on leading news (FBI arrest of Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder in a corruption probe), protests, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, criminal investigations (including a note about a federal judge considering releasing Ghislaine Maxwell's testimony), financial crime, cyber division, law enforcement services, international relations, other FBI news, and other Washington news. The document is a compilation of news summaries from various media outlets.

persons.name: Larry Householder
persons.context: Arrested by the FBI in a $60 million corruption and bribery scheme related to a nuclear power plant bailout bill.

persons.name: Matt Borges
persons.context: Arrested alongside Larry Householder in the Ohio corruption probe.

persons.name: Neil Clark
persons.context: Arrested alongside Larry Householder in the Ohio corruption probe.

persons.name: Juan Cespedes
persons.role: Lobbyist and Ohio Civil Rights Commission Member
persons.context: Arrested alongside Larry Householder in the Ohio corruption probe.

persons.name: Jeff Longstreth
persons.context: Arrested alongside Larry Householder in the Ohio corruption probe.

persons.name: David DeVillers
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Ohio
persons.context: Held a press conference detailing the charges against Householder and associates.

persons.name: Mike DeWine
persons.context: Called for Speaker Householder to resign following his arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a criminal investigations section; a federal judge is considering releasing her testimony about her sex life from a 2015 lawsuit.

persons.name: Loretta Preska
persons.context: Scheduled a conference to discuss unsealing records from a 2015 lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Filed a defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the potential unsealing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Asked the judge in Maxwell's criminal case to issue a gag order on prosecutors, FBI agents, and lawyers.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the officials whose public comments Maxwell's lawyer cited in requesting a gag order.

persons.name: William Sweeney
persons.role: Head of New York's FBI Office
persons.context: His public comments about Maxwell were cited in her lawyer's request for a gag order.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in numerous news items, including comments on protests, the pandemic, and briefly stating he hadn't followed Ghislaine Maxwell's case and wished her well.

persons.name: Kayleigh McEnany
persons.context: Commented on various issues, including the prosecution of the McCloskeys and mail-in voting problems.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Wrote an op-ed criticizing the deployment of federal officers in Portland; also mentioned as someone Senator Graham plans to call to testify.

persons.name: Andrew McCabe
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Senator Graham plans to call to testify.

persons.name: Sally Yates
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Senator Graham plans to call to testify.

persons.name: Lindsey Graham
persons.context: Stated that Yates, Comey, and McCabe would be called to testify before the election.

persons.name: Roy Den Hollander
persons.context: Prime suspect in the attack on Judge Esther Salas's family and the murder of attorney Marc Angelucci in California.

persons.name: Esther Salas
persons.context: Her son was killed and husband injured in an attack at their home, allegedly by Roy Den Hollander.

persons.name: Marc Angelucci
persons.context: Murdered in California; Roy Den Hollander is the prime suspect.

connections.description: Both were arrested in the same Ohio corruption and bribery probe.

Maxwell is described as Epstein's ex-girlfriend and alleged co-conspirator in sex trafficking.
Giuffre is an Epstein accuser who filed a defamation lawsuit against Maxwell.
Den Hollander is the prime suspect in the attack that killed Judge Salas's son and injured her husband.

events.title: FBI Arrests Ohio House Speaker in Corruption Probe
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder and four associates in a $60 million bribery scheme related to passing a $1.3 billion nuclear power plant bailout bill.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in Bradford, New Hampshire, on sex trafficking charges related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Judge Considers Releasing Maxwell Testimony
events.description: U.S. District Judge Loretta Preska scheduled a conference to discuss unsealing records from a 2015 defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell, including testimony about her sex life.

events.title: Attack on Judge Esther Salas's Family
events.description: A gunman attacked the family of federal Judge Esther Salas at their New Jersey home, killing her son and injuring her husband. Suspect Roy Den Hollander was later found dead.

events.title: Murder of Attorney Marc Angelucci
events.description: Attorney Marc Angelucci was shot to death at his home in San Bernardino County, California. Roy Den Hollander is the prime suspect.

keyFacts: The FBI arrested Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder and four associates in a massive $60 million bribery and corruption scheme centered on a nuclear power plant bailout.
A federal judge is considering unsealing Ghislaine Maxwell's testimony about her sex life from a 2015 defamation lawsuit, as her criminal case proceeds.
The suspect in the attack on Judge Esther Salas's family, Roy Den Hollander, is also the prime suspect in the murder of California attorney Marc Angelucci.
The FBI News Briefing is a daily compilation of news summaries from various media outlets, covering a wide spectrum of national and international topics.
The document shows the breadth of FBI involvement in July 2020, from political corruption and violent crime to counter-intelligence and cyber hacking cases.
